title: Ophryneion
description: Ophryneion was an ancient city of the northern Troad. It lay between Rhoteum and Dardanus. The site is located about 1.5 km north-east of the village of İntepe (previously known as Erenköy) in Çanakkale Province, Turkey.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 14023

properties.description: Point location representing the modern community of Erenköy which is thought to be associated with the ancient site of Ophryneion. Geometry derived from an OpenStreetMap node.
properties.title: OSM location of modern Erenköy
